identity.mission: Create a Banker's Algorithm simulation that feels like a high-stakes 'Quantum Lab' interface rather than a textbook diagram. Academic rigor meets futuristic precision.
principles: Fusion: Operating Systems logic + FinTech dashboard density.
Emotion: The tension of 'Deadlock' vs. the relief of 'Safe State'.
Content: Data is the art. Matrices are beautiful grids, not spreadsheets.
Contrast: Deep dark backgrounds with luminous, neon data points.

usage.data_values: JetBrains Mono, font-medium (CRITICAL for matrix alignment)
usage.code_snippets: JetBrains Mono, text-xs, bg-muted/50 p-1 rounded

MatrixGrid.description: A visual grid representing Allocation, Max, or Need matrices.
MatrixGrid.cell_style: h-10 w-10 flex items-center justify-center rounded-md border border-border/50 bg-card text-sm font-mono transition-all duration-300

ProcessCard.description: Card representing a single process in the queue.
ProcessCard.style: flex items-center justify-between p-3 rounded-lg border border-border bg-card hover:border-primary/50 transition-colors

ControlPanel.style: space-y-4 p-4 rounded-xl border border-border bg-card/50 backdrop-blur-sm

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. USE RECHARTS instead of Chart.js. It is already installed in package.json.
2. IGNORE 'Vanilla JS' requirement in problem statement; use the provided React + Tailwind + Shadcn stack.
3. IMPLEMENT 'MatrixGrid' as a reusable component. It is the core visual element.
4. ENSURE the 'Need' matrix updates automatically when 'Allocation' or 'Max' changes.
5. USE 'sonner' for all system notifications (e.g., 'Request Granted', 'Unsafe State Detected').
6. CREATE a 'SimulationContext' or use a global store to manage the algorithm state (Available, Allocation, Need, etc.) to avoid prop drilling hell.
7. ADD 'data-testid' to all inputs and buttons (e.g., 'input-allocation-p0-r1', 'btn-calculate').
universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for text.
Use 'backdrop-blur-md' for overlays and sticky headers.
Ensure all text inputs have 'font-mono' for numerical data.
Never use pure black (#000000); use #09090b or #020617.
Add subtle borders (border-white/5) to cards to define edges in dark mode.
